findings.title: Admin can change the tax and liquidity fee
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to modify the tax and liquidity fees, which could lead to potential security risks.

findings.title: Admin can change the maximum transaction amount
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to modify the maximum transaction amount, which could lead to potential security risks.

findings.title: Admin can exclude from the fee
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to exclude certain addresses or users from paying fees.

findings.title: Admin can change minimum number of tokens to add to liquidity
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to modify the minimum number of tokens required to add liquidity.

findings.title: Admin change fee addresses
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to change the fee addresses.

findings.title: Admin can change fee percents
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to modify fee percentages, which could lead to potential security risks.

findings.title: Admin can change current owner
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to change the current owner of the contract.

findings.title: Admin can withdraw tokens from the contract
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to withdraw tokens from the contract.

findings.title: Admin can change symbol
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to modify the token's symbol.

findings.title: Owner can lock and unlock
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to lock and unlock, which could allow them to retake privileges even after ownership was renounced.

findings.title: Unprotected functions
findings.description: The functions setSwapAndLiquifyEnabled, setMaxTxAmount, setNumTokensSellToAddToLiquidity, setFeeAddresses, setFeePercents, setOwner, and withdrawLiquidity are unprotected and can be accessed by anyone.
